title: Rural indebtedness rising due to unregulated microfinance institutions: Brinda Karat
content: Leading a demonstration in front of Regional Office of the RBI, Ms. Karat said, “public sector banks are giving loans to MFIs at low interest rate. They are jacking up the interest without any cap on interest rate. The SHGs and individual women are taking loan at very high rate of interest.”

title: SRMIST signs MoU with NIFTEM
content: Both the institutions will facilitate student, faculty, and staff exchange programmes and internships

title: Congress, CPI(M) leaders in Bengal say ‘rising infiltrators’ narrative of BJP proved wrong after SIR draft list
content: CPI(M) State secretary Mohammad Salim added that many vulnerable people from tribal communities, women, rented accommodation holders, street dwellers stand a chance to be omitted in the SIR process due to lack of concrete documents and should be looked into.

title: Rajasthan High Court refuses to order immediate student union elections
content: The petitioners contended that the student representation constituted a “core democratic entitlement” and the students could not be deprived of the democratic right; State government argued that the polls would disrupt academics during National Education Policy rollout

title: Govt. to launch nationwide awareness campaign on VB-G RAM G scheme
content: It will operate as a Centrally Sponsored Scheme (CSS), with a fund sharing pattern of 90:10 for North-Eastern and Himalayan States/UT and 60:40 for all other States; the law provides for unemployment allowance if job is not provided within 15 days, at prescribed rates, to be paid by State governments.

title: Leopard spotted in Thane, injuring several people
content: According to a Navghar police official, a few residents from Parijat housing society and some passersby were injured who were passing by on the Talav Road in Bhayandar East in the early hours

title: CIAL hands over ₹79.82 crore dividend to Kerala govt.
content: CIAL recorded the highest revenue and profit in its history during the 2024–25 financial year, achieving a total revenue of ₹1,142 crore and a net profit of ₹489.84 crore

title: Around 4,000 micro-observers to scrutinise SIR hearing process in West Bengal
content: Sources in the CEO’s office said that micro-observers will check for any discrepancies during hearings, and would report any red flags to EROs, AEROs and District Electoral Officers.

title: BJP working president Nitin Nabin meets PM Modi
content: Mr. Nabin was appointed as the BJP working president on December 14, marking a generational shift in the party; he assumed charge on December 15.

title: AI training programme for government officials to be launched
content: The Indian Institute of Technology-Madras is tying up with Google and Digital Futures Lab for the initiative

title: MMTS: Hyderabad’s overlooked lifeline waiting for a comeback
content: Daily commuters urge South Central Railway authorities to boost frequency, punctuality, and daytime services of MMTS along key suburban routes; they also point out that economical fares, eco-friendliness and coverage through dense neighbourhoods make it a ready solution

title: 200-year-old St. John Church in Secunderabad gets a makeover
content: The church has undergone extensive restoration work, including roof replacement and structural repairs, for which specialists used traditional methods and materials to preserve its heritage features; it is now ready to welcome parishioners and host Christmas celebrations

title: Govt. to increase reservation for Agniveers in CAPFs to 50%
content: After notifying the reservation of 50% constable posts in BSF, Home Ministry moves to enhance reservation in Group C posts for ex-Agniveers in other CAPFs; new policy marks a shift from government’s earlier decision

title: Kamal Haasan seeks clarification over road map for ramping up India’s nuclear power generation
content: The Rajya Sabha member recently raised two questions in Parliament related to the strategy and timeline for scaling up nuclear capacity under the Nuclear Energy Mission and the discontinuation of E10 petrol

title: Large-scale deletions reinforce AIADMK’s demand for SIR, says Edappadi Palaniswami
content: Urging electors not to panic in the event of their names having been left out of the roll, the AIADMK leader says his party will ensure that no genuine voters were omitted from the final rolls

title: Health check-up finds 5.77 lakh govt. school, PU students in Karnataka have hypertension
content: Officials involved in the work cautioned that these should not be read as confirmed cases but as those that need further attention and evaluation

title: Honesty, integrity are non-negotiable in recruitment, President Murmu tells PSCs
content: Conference brings together chairpersons of the Union and State Public Service Commissions to deliberate on strengthening recruitment systems, enhancing role of PSCs in governance framework

title: DSP stabbed by couple in Chhattisgarh’s Dantewada over old dispute
content: The woman had registered a case of rape against the police officer in Durg district late last year but the latter was acquitted this September

title: Haryana Assembly: No-confidence motion against BJP government defeated after Opposition stages walkout
content: In the absence of Congress MLAs, the Speaker put the motion to vote which was rejected after a five-hour debate that went on till 10.15 p.m.

title: 'Cutting the queue': AI Express grounds pilot over assault on passenger; probe on
content: In a dramatic turn of events at Delhi airport, an Air India Express pilot found himself grounded after supposedly attacking a passenger amidst a scuffle over a security queue. The passenger described the ordeal, sharing how he emerged with a bloodied face before the pilot’s scheduled flight to Bengaluru.

title: Unbeaten run rolls on! Gambhir's India clinch 5th T20I, seal series 3–1
content: India won the fifth and final T20I against South Africa by 30 runs to seal the five-match series 3-1 after the last game was abandoned due to fog. After posting 231/5, India turned the game with Jasprit Bumrah’s key spell and Varun Chakaravarthy’s four wickets, restricting South Africa to 201/8 despite a strong start.

title: 'Will be hit harder if ... ': Trump's warning as US strikes ISIS targets in Syria
content: Following the deaths of two American soldiers and a US civilian interpreter in Syria, President Trump announced Operation Hawkeye Strike, a severe retaliation against ISIS targets. The US is striking ISIS strongholds in Deir ez-Zor, Raqqa, and near Palmyra, aiming at weapons depots and command centers. Trump issued a stern warning to any group threatening the USA.

title: Nadella Issues AI Ultimatum: CEO demands full commitment from top brass
content: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella is demanding executives fully embrace the company's AI transformation or face departure.  He views AI as both a critical opportunity and a potential threat, personally engaging leaders to ensure commitment.  This aggressive push involves significant organizational shifts and a renewed focus on technical innovation to prevent obsolescence.

title: Delhi-NCR, interrupted: Day 2 of border troubles & tempers
content: Commuters faced significant disruption as Delhi enforced a ban on non-BS 6 vehicles from other states, leading to confusion and fines at border checkpoints. Many were turned back or forced to take lengthy detours, highlighting a lack of coordination and public awareness regarding the new pollution control measures.

title: Sharif Osman Hadi to be buried beside national poet Kazi Nazrul Islam; protests persist
content: Sharif Osman Hadi, a key figure in recent Bangladesh protests, will be buried next to national poet Kazi Nazrul Islam. Hadi died in Singapore after being shot in Dhaka earlier this month. His death has ignited widespread protests demanding justice, with demonstrators targeting Indian diplomatic missions and alleging suspects fled to India.

title: Meta AI’s highest-paid employee unhappy; calls management 'suffocating'
content: Meta's $14.8 billion investment in Scale AI and the integration of its CEO, Alexandr Wang, into a new "superintelligence" lab are reportedly facing internal friction. Wang allegedly finds Mark Zuckerberg's micromanagement "suffocating," while some staff question Wang's experience. This shift also clashes with Meta's open-source AI philosophy, leading to executive departures.

title: ‘Behead’ slogan is a call to armed rebellion, says HC denies bail to accused
content: The Allahabad high court declared the slogan "gustakh-e-nabi ki ek hi saza, sar tan se juda" as provocative and a challenge to India's law and sovereignty. The observation came while denying bail to an accused arrested after violence during a protest, highlighting the slogan's potential to incite rebellion and its misuse.

title: Bill Goldberg & Wanda Ferraton Net Worth 2025: WWE earnings and investments
content: Bill Goldberg, a wrestling icon, boasts a net worth of $16 million in 2025, primarily from his WWE career and merchandise. His wife, Wanda Ferraton, an actress turned businesswoman, contributes $1 million to their combined $17 million fortune. The couple, married since 2005, now balances family life with their ongoing professional endeavors.

title: 97.3 lakh deleted from Tamil Nadu draft rolls, 73.7 lakh in Gujarat
content: Tamil Nadu and Gujarat's draft voter lists have seen significant deletions, with over 97 lakh and 73 lakh names removed respectively. Millions more face notices for "logical discrepancies" in their enrollment details. Claims and objections are now open until January 18th for affected voters.

title: Warner Bros-Netflix deal: WBD wants Oracle founder’s backing
content: Warner Bros. Discovery (WBD) has rejected Paramount Skydance's $108 billion hostile takeover bid, deeming it "misleading" and "inadequate." WBD's board urged shareholders to reject the offer, citing financial concerns and a lack of a strong personal guarantee from Larry Ellison. The company reiterated its preference for a merger agreement with Netflix, which it considers superior and more transparent.

title: Micah Parsons injury update: Insider raises concerns over his return next season
content: The Green Bay Packers suffered a tough loss on last Sunday as their star player, Micah Parsons, sustained an ACL tear and left the game midway after he was in pain. This has sparked chaos as now popular NFL insider has shared more details about Micah Parsons' return to the field in the next season.

title: Inside Josh Allen’s luxury car collection: Bills QB’s impressive garage
content: Buffalo Bills quarterback Josh Allen's impressive car collection showcases his journey from humble beginnings to NFL stardom. His garage features a mix of rugged trucks like the Ford F-150 Raptor and luxury SUVs such as the Jeep Grand Wagoneer and Range Rover Sport, reflecting his need for utility and comfort in Buffalo's climate.

title: Bret Hart & Stephanie Washington net worth 2025: Wrestling legacy and assets
content: Bret Hart, known as "The Hitman," has amassed a net worth of $7 million through his successful wrestling career with WCW and WWE, merchandise, and royalties. He married his third wife, Stephanie, in 2010, and their joint assets include their Alberta home. Despite a significant age gap, Stephanie has supported Hart through his health challenges.

title: Randi Mahomes thanks fans after Patrick Mahomes’ knee surgery message
content: Patrick Mahomes’ mom sends message after Chiefs QB’s surgery as the Kansas City quarterback begins rehab following a torn ACL and LCL. Randi Mahomes thanks fans for prayers and support while Patrick Mahomes shares an emotional response to the injury. Here is what the Mahomes family said and what the timeline looks like for the Chiefs moving forward.

title: Vanessa Bryant Net Worth 2025: Wealth, legacy and life after Kobe Bryant
content: Vanessa Bryant now handles the vast financial legacy of her late husband and basketball legend, Kobe Bryant. Her net worth is estimated at $600 million as of 2025. She manages investments, endorsements, including Body Armor, and manages real estate. Vanessa also leads Granity Studios and Mamba Cita clothing and uses the money she earns from it to support young athletes. She continues brand partnerships and the Mamba & Mamba Cita Sports Foundation.

title: CSR must inherently include environment & ecology, rules SC
content: The Supreme Court has mandated that environmental protection is a core component of corporate social responsibility, not mere charity.  In a landmark ruling, the court directed non-renewable power generators in Rajasthan and Gujarat to contribute to the survival of the critically endangered Great Indian Bustard.  This decision underscores the constitutional duty of corporations to safeguard the environment.

title: PM Modi launches global e-library, which puts traditional meds on world map
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi launched the Traditional Medicine Global Library (TMGL) at the WHO Global Summit on Traditional Medicine, establishing a shared international platform for ancient health systems. The digital library aims to anchor Ayurveda, yoga, and other traditions in research and policy, ensuring equal access to authentic information for all countries.

title: Rahul Gandhi calls G RAM G bill anti-rural poor, vows to force government to withdraw it
content: Rahul Gandhi stated Congress will force the PM Modi government to withdraw the disbanding of the MGNREGA job guarantee scheme, warning it's the BJP's next target after farmers' protests led to the rollback of farm laws. He asserted the scheme provides crucial leverage to vulnerable sections, which the government aims to break.

title: Asking wife to keep expense sheet not cruelty, rules SC
content: The Supreme Court quashed an FIR against a husband, stating that asking his wife to maintain an Excel sheet for household expenses does not constitute cruelty. The court emphasized that such domestic disputes often stem from the 'daily wear and tear' of marriage and should not be used to initiate criminal proceedings without specific evidence of harm.

title: At Speaker's chamber, a rare show of government-opposition bonhomie
content: A post-parliamentary session tea gathering saw a rare convivial atmosphere between government and opposition MPs, including PM Modi and Priyanka Gandhi Vadra. Despite recent parliamentary rancor, the informal meeting fostered cordiality, with discussions ranging from foreign trips to parliamentary diligence. The session concluded with a focus on positive interactions, a contrast to the preceding legislative debates.

title: India's delayed $5-trillion dream: What IMF’s new timeline means for your wallet; impact on EMI, taxes
content: India's $5 trillion economy target has been pushed to 2028-29, primarily due to currency depreciation and lower-than-expected nominal GDP growth. While the real economy continues to grow, this delay impacts imported goods, foreign education costs, and potentially government finances, urging a focus on long-term financial planning over political timelines.

title: IND vs SA: Hardik Pandya goes full throttle in 5th T20I; hits 16-ball fifty
content: Hardik Pandya made an immediate impact in Ahmedabad. He hit a six off his first ball, which struck a cameraman. Pandya then smashed three sixes and two fours in one over. He reached his half-century in just 16 balls. Pandya was dismissed after scoring 63 runs off 25 balls. India won the match.

title: Madhuri Dixit on sons’ careers: Ryan not into films, Arin works at Apple
content: As her web series Mrs. Deshpande releases, Madhuri Dixit has opened up about her sons’ career interests, revealing that neither Arin nor Ryan is keen on entering the film industry. In a recent interview, the actor shared how her children view Bollywood and why they have chosen paths far removed from the limelight.

title: SIR showdown: Over 97 lakh voters deleted in poll-bound TN; 14.2 lakh in Chennai alone
content: Tamil Nadu's draft electoral roll after the SIR has 5.43 crore voters. The SIR exercise removed over 97 lakh names. The exercise, opposed by chief minister MK Stalin, aimed to ensure accuracy but drew criticism for potentially deleting legitimate voters. Similar revisions are under way in West Bengal, which lakhs of voters were deleted.

title: U19 Asia Cup: India beat Sri Lanka in semi-final; to face Pakistan in title clash
content: India Under-19 secured a spot in the Asia Cup final. They defeated Sri Lanka U19 by eight wickets in a rain-affected semi-final. Vihaan Malhotra and Aaron George guided India to victory after bowlers restricted Sri Lanka. India will now face Pakistan in the final, their first meeting in an Asia Cup final in eleven years.

title: 'No agreement': Sidda rejects power-sharing theory; K'taka CM row intensifies
content: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah has dismissed claims of a two-and-a-half-year power-sharing arrangement within the state government. He asserted that he will remain CM until the party high command decides otherwise, refuting opposition questions about a potential leadership change. Deputy CM D.K. Shivakumar also denied rumors of a dinner meeting, emphasizing party unity.

title: Drake London injury update: Falcons WR gets positive news vs Cardinals
content: The Atlanta Falcons' wide receiver, Drake London, has been away from the field since Week 11 after he sustained a brutal PCL strain. As the team gears up for the last three matches of the season, there have been some positive updates about Drake London's return to the field in this season.

title: Vaping, woof & shouting match: Viral moments from Parliament Winter Session - watch
content: The Lok Sabha's 19-day Winter Session concluded with a productivity of 111 percent, marked by the passage of key bills like the Viksit Bharat–Guarantee for Rozgar and Ajeevika Mission (Gramin) Bill. The session witnessed heated debates, protests, and viral moments, including accusations of vaping, a Congress MP bringing a puppy, and unruly scenes during bill passages.

title: The 90% surge: What's behind sudden rise in India's exports to China, will it hold?
content: India's exports to China saw a significant 90% surge in November, reaching $2.2 billion, primarily driven by naphtha and specific electronics. However, this spike masks underlying volatility and a growing import dependence on China. The trade deficit with China is widening, raising concerns about India's export strategy and reliance on Chinese goods.

title: 4 Everyday foods that may reduce constipation, bloating and gas
content: Constipation, a common digestive issue, can be effectively managed through diet. Incorporating fiber-rich foods like fruits, vegetables, whole grains, and legumes, alongside regular exercise, promotes regular bowel movements. Understanding the roles of soluble and insoluble fiber, and consuming specific foods like oats, prunes, leafy greens, and yogurt can prevent and alleviate constipation.

title: SHANTI, but not quiet: How India is rewriting rules of nuclear energy
content: Parliament has passed the SHANTI Bill, 2025, opening India's civil nuclear sector to private and foreign investment for the first time. This landmark law aims to boost clean energy, enabling a significant increase in nuclear capacity and attracting substantial investment. The bill overhauls governance, redefining liability and establishing the AERB as an independent safety regulator.

title: SIR in Gujarat: Nearly 74 lakh names deleted from rolls; EC opens window for objections
content: Gujarat has removed nearly 74 lakh names from its electoral rolls, reducing the total voter count from 5.08 crore to 4.34 crore. This extensive clean-up, part of the Special Intensive Revision exercise, targeted deceased, absent, and duplicate voters. The updated draft rolls are now public, with a deadline of January 18 for objections and claims.

title: US' BlueBird satellite launch on December 24: Isro
content: India's space agency ISRO is set to launch a US commercial satellite, 'BlueBird Block-2', on December 24th using its LVM-3 rocket. This mission highlights India's growing prowess in space, capable of launching large satellites for global leaders. The advanced satellite aims to provide high-speed cellular broadband to smartphones worldwide.

title: 'Bat him at No. 3’: Former India batter makes strong case for Sanju Samson ahead of T20 World Cup
content: With the T20 World Cup approaching, India's batting dominance has waned, marked by a drop in strike rate and uncertainty in the opening combination. While past success was built on aggressive intent, recent struggles from key players like Suryakumar Yadav and Shubman Gill raise concerns about team balance and leadership form.

title: IND vs SA: Umpire down! Sanju Samson's rocket shot hits official – Watch
content: In the match between India and South Africa,  there was a concerning moment that saw umpire Rohan Pandit getting struck on the knee by a powerful Sanju Samson shot. Play paused as medical staff attended to the official. India were in a dominant position at 95/1 in the ninth over when the incident occurred.

title: Trump and the art of adding your name next to Kennedy
content: Donald Trump has never been a president comfortable with abstraction. His idea of power is tactile. You can walk through it, host a dinner in it, point to it from across the street. This is why his second term has been accompanied not just by policy reversals but by an unusual fixation on physical space.

title: Vijay Hazare Trophy: Rohit Sharma to play in first 2 matches
content: Rohit Sharma will play Mumbai's first two Vijay Hazare Trophy matches, while Suryakumar Yadav, Yashasvi Jaiswal, and Shivam Dube are absent. Shardul Thakur will captain the squad, which also includes Sarfaraz Khan and his brother Musheer. Ajinkya Rahane will rest due to a hamstring issue.

title: School paradox: Govt enrolment dominates even as thousands of classrooms empty
content: India’s government schools still educate most children, but the system is increasingly mis-sized. In 2024–25, over 65,000 government schools reported zero or near-zero enrolment, even as teacher postings stayed intact. In several states, private schools now enrol more students than government schools. The data points to misalignment, not collapse—enrolment shifts faster than consolidation and redeployment.

title: BJP National Working President Nitin Nabin to visit Patna on December 23
content: Bihar BJP President Sanjay Saraogi said that BJP workers, along with the people of Patna and State, had been eagerly awaiting this day and now the wait is finally coming to an end.

title: Centre revises guidelines to help poor prisoners unable to pay fines, arrange sureties
content: Unhappy with the response from States and Union Territories, MHA directs jail officials to refer cases of poor prisoners and undertrials to District Legal Services Authority to facilitate release of financial assistance

title: Centre blames Opposition for stalling Parliament debate on pollution
content: As Winter Session ends, Parliamentary Affairs Minister Kiren Rijiju slams Opposition conduct and blames Congress for stalling Parliamentary debate on air pollution

title: Centre plans portal to take process of forest rights’ recognition, management online
content: Tribal Affairs Ministry said the portal is proposed to act as a single window for all Forest Rights Act processes, which include filing and processing of claims, issuing digital title deeds, storing legacy data on titles granted

title: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan defends IFFK against censorship and Centre’s interference
content: Pinarayi Vijayan criticises the Union Ministry of Information and Broadcasting for denying censor exemptions to 19 films, labelling the actions as a direct assault on freedom of expression and a manifestation of ‘anti-democratic’ sentiments.

title: Corporations have a fundamental duty to protect ecosystem, prevent species’ extinction: Supreme Court
content: Corporate duty must evolve from merely protecting shareholders; non-renewable power generators near the Great Indian Bustard’s habitats are “guests in its abode”, must pay for in-situ and ex-situ conservation

title: DCC strikes deal with rebel winner to retain Thiruvambady panchayat
content: Jithin Pallat, who contested from Punnakkal ward as a rebel candidate and won with a margin of 535 votes, will be offered the post of president as part of a strategic compromise

title: West Bengal BJP flags violence in Bangladesh, Trinamool hits back
content: Since August 2024, when former Bangladesh Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina had to flee the country, the West Bengal unit of the BJP has been highlighting the alleged violence and attacks against Hindus in Bangladesh

title: RJD accuses Jitan Ram Manjhi of winning elections by vote rigging
content: A purported video of the HAM(S) leader saying he had ‘helped’ a party candidate win election has gone viral; Union Minister hits back at the Opposition, says the video had been doctored, ‘he is no longer afraid of anyone’

title: IBM to skill 5 million Indians in AI, cybersecurity, quantum computing by 2030
content: India possesses the talent and ambition to lead the world in AI & Quantum. Fluency in frontier technologies will define economic competitiveness, scientific progress and societal transformation, says IBM Chief Arvind Krishna

title: State Animal Welfare Board pushes for stricter stray dog vaccination measures in Kerala
content: The board also recommends bringing in amendments to the Kerala Panchayat Raj Act and the Kerala Municipalities Act to prevent pet dogs from being abandoned on the streets.

title: I have never been politically weak, asserts Siddaramaiah
content: Chief Minister on Thursday night had held a dinner meeting with some of his supporters in the home of Satish Jarkiholi

title: HC quashes GO allowing company to set up brewery at Elappully
content: Court observes that many aspects considered by the government while according preliminary sanction were not factually correct

title: V-C appointments gain momentum after Governor-CM talks; Opposition alleges “secret understanding”
content: Reports suggest a renewed push to make permanent appointments at all universities that have been helmed by interim V-Cs for several years

title: SIT detains two persons of interest in the Sabarimala gold theft case for questioning
content: Persons in SIT custody include a Bengaluru-based jeweller and the owner of a metalworks factory in Chennai

title: Child trafficking and commercial sexual exploitation a ‘deeply disturbing reality’ in India: Supreme Court
content: Top court emphasises that courts must not disbelieve the testimony of a trafficked child just because of minor inconsistencies in her evidence; says she must be treated as an injured witness, not accomplice

title: Kerala local body polls: UDF won 38.81% and LDF 33.45% of votes, show vote share data released by State Election Commission
content: While BJP-led NDA claims 14.71% of the votes, 13.03% of the votes went to other parties and Independents

title: New labour codes: Kerala to take the lead in pressuring Centre to protect workers’ rights
content: At a national-level labour conclave in the State, it was decided that the State Labour Minister and Central trade union representatives will meet the Union Labour Minister soon, pointing out the anti-worker nature of the labour codes

title: Driverless train prototype for Bengaluru metro’s Pink Line to arrive at Kothanur depot soon
content: BEML earlier this year unveiled the prototype of its new driverless metro train developed for Namma Metro’s Phase-2 corridors, including Phase 2A and 2B

title: KIIFB masala bonds: Kerala HC reserves judgment on ED appeal against interim stay by single judge
content: Single judge issued interim stay on further proceedings in a plea filed by KIIFB challenging the ED notice, in connection with the use of funds generated through masala bonds for infrastructure development in the State

title: Watch: ECI deletes over 97 lakh voters in Tamil Nadu, 73 lakh in Gujarat
content: The Election Commission of India published draft electoral rolls for Tamil Nadu and Gujarat after the Special Intensive Revision, removing over 97 lakh voters in Tamil Nadu and 73.73 lakh in Gujarat.

title: IFFK 2025: Japanese film Two Seasons, Two Strangers wins Suvarna Chakoram
content: Argentine filmmakers Carina Piazza and Lucía Bracelis win Rajatha Chakoram award for best director for the film Before the Body

title: Tamil Nadu SIR draft electoral roll: How to check your name in voter list
content: The draft electoral roll for Tamil Nadu after the Special Intensive Revision was released on December 19, 2025

title: Chief Secretary calls for foolproof arrangements for Godavari Pushkarams in 2027
content: Directing the Collectors to prepare and submit detailed DPRs on various aspects, Vijayanand stresses need for using advanced technologies for handling massive crowds expected for the event

title: Skaggs family settles lawsuit, asks MLB to act
content: The Angels and the family of Tyler Skaggs have agreed to a last-minute settlement over the civil lawsuit stemming from the former pitcher's death in 2019.

title: Sources: Rockets expand talks to buy, move Sun
content: Rockets ownership is in substantive talks with the Connecticut Sun over the potential purchase and relocation of the WNBA franchise to Houston, sources told ESPN.

title: Seahawks OLB Hall suspended one game by NFL
content: The NFL is suspending Seahawks outside linebacker Derick Hall for one game without pay for an act of unnecessary roughness and unsportsmanlike conduct during Thursday night's game against the Rams.

title: NBA outlines tighter rules for injury info, prop bets
content: The NBA is considering potential policy changes to address tanking, increase the frequency of injury reporting and restrict what sportsbooks offer, according to a memo sent to all teams Friday.

title: Tulane's Sumrall mourns father's death before CFP
content: Tulane coach Jon Sumrall mourned the death of his father Friday, a day before the Green Wave make their College Football Playoff debut against Ole Miss.

title: Dodgers lead MLB with record $169M luxury tax
content: The Los Angeles Dodgers will pay a record $169.4 million luxury tax after winning their second straight World Series title.

title: Kelce to play final 3 games as he ponders future
content: Despite the Chiefs getting eliminated from the NFL's postseason last week, Travis Kelce, the team's star tight end, plans to play in each of the final three games this season.

title: Canes' Allen out for season after cancer diagnosis
content: Miami sophomore forward Marcus Allen has been diagnosed with non-Hodgkin lymphoma and will miss the remainder of the season.

title: 🏈 2026 NFL draft: Five-team race for No. 1 pick
content: The Raiders, Browns, Titans, Giants and Jets are front-runners for the No. 1 pick. What would they do with the top selection?

title: Jake Paul-Anthony Joshua live updates, results and analysis
content: Jake Paul faces the toughest test of his career Friday against former heavyweight champion Anthony Joshua. Follow live.

title: Sights and sounds from the first round of the College Football Playoff
content: Four campuses across the country were abuzz over the weekend as the College Football Playoff came to town.

title: Our guide to every Week 16 NFL game: Matchup previews, predictions and what's at stake
content: Must-win game for Lions? Can Dallas still make the postseason? We have picks, predictions and stats for every game.

title: How different is Pete Golding from Lane Kiffin? Start with social media and yoga
content: After weeks of speculation and turmoil, the Rebels and their new coach are eager to get back on the field.

title: NBA MVP straw poll: 14 players received votes -- two lead the way
content: SGA? Jokic? Cup MVP Jalen Brunson? We polled 100 media members in a ballot that mirrors the league's official vote.

title: 'That's going to probably piss off some pitchers': How MLB teams are approaching new ball-strike challenge system
content: The strategic side of baseball's next big rule change is already in motion. Here's the early thinking from MLB managers.

title: Reranking power conferences: A Big Ten vs. Big 12 battle for No. 1
content: Which of the five basketball power conferences is more likely to produce this season's national champion?

title: Power Rankings: It's Arizona vs. Michigan for No. 1
content: The Wildcats and Wolverines are battling it out for the title of best team in the country. See the full top 25.

title: Coveted head coaching jobs that might come open this offseason
content: Which opening would be most attractive? Let's sort eight possible openings, starting with Cincinnati.

title: Did you know there are 13 active former No. 1 picks in the NFL? We examine them all
content: Matthew Stafford, Myles Garrett are having the best seasons of all 13 of the former No. 1 picks currently in the NFL.

title: Proof that Texas A&M volleyball's run is more methodical than magical
content: The Aggies reject the notion that their NCAA women's volleyball title game run is magical, or that they're riding momentum. They say it's by design.

title: Laurens' weekend preview: Mbappé's quest to overtake Ronaldo, Spurs-Liverpool, more
content: What is Julien Laurens watching this weekend? For starters, Kylian Mbappé's quest to make Madrid history, plus the Africa Cup of Nations kicks off.

title: On the racetrack or in the air, Greg Biffle will be remembered as a hero
content: Greg Biffle died in a plane crash Thursday in North Carolina, where he'll be remembered not only as a NASCAR star, but as a humanitarian, too.

title: Want to beat the Oklahoma City Thunder? This five-step guide tells you how
content: Using the Spurs' and Trail Blazers' wins over Oklahoma City as a blueprint, let's evaluate the most important factors of a Thunder loss.

title: Scandals, prediction markets: Is 2025 a turning point for sports betting?
content: Here are the stories that dominated sports betting's year -- and will continue to be battlegrounds in 2026.

title: Week 16 betting guide: Backing Maye to throw Patriots to a W
content: Our experts dive into the lines and player props that offer value for Week 16 and share their tips and bets.

title: Ranking the top 50 players in the College Football Playoff
content: Who takes the top spot? Our college football experts rank the top 50 players from the College Football Playoff teams.

title: WNBA CBA negotiations: What WNBPA's move to authorize strike means for labor talks
content: The Jan. 9 deadline is still weeks away, but the WNBPA has voted to authorize calling a strike "when necessary" during negotiations.

title: Heading into her final Olympics, Hilary Knight's impact is as big as ever
content: The 2026 Winter Olympics will be Knight's last playing for Team USA. She remains one of the faces of U.S. women's hockey.

title: Ranking the top 10 freshmen by impact
content: USC's Jazzy Davidson tops our rankings also featuring Oklahoma's Aaliyah Chavez, UConn's Blanca Quiñonez and more.

title: The Playbook: Shadow Reports, lineup locks for Week 16
content: An all-encompassing look at the matchups to exploit or avoid and lineup locks in fantasy, as well as projected scores for all NFL games.

title: Why did Hamilton's debut season at Ferrari go sideways? Will it get any better in 2026?
content: Lewis Hamilton's move to Ferrari was supposed to be a dream come true, but it became a nightmare. Will 2026's regulation change make things right?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United eye Al Hilal star Neves
content: Manchester United have been put on alert as Al Hilal midfielder Rúben Neves wants to return to the Premier League. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Epstein Files Show Clinton Reclining In Hot Tub, Trump's Name In Contact Book
content: The US Justice Department on Friday began releasing the long-awaited records from the investigation into the politically explosive case of convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.

title: Air India, IndiGo Issue Travel Advisories Amid Fog-Related Daisruptions
content: Both Air India and IndiGo, in an attempt to mitigate fog-related disruptions, such as reduced visibility that affects flight operations, issued travel advisories for passengers during the holiday season.

title: Musk Wins Appeal And Restores 2018 Tesla Pay Deal Worth $56 Billion
content: Elon Musk's 2018 pay package from Tesla, once worth $56 billion, was restored by the Delaware Supreme Court on Friday, two years after a lower court struck down the compensation deal as "unfathomable."

title: US Carries Out Large-Scale Retaliatory Strikes Against ISIS In Syria
content: The U.S. military launched airstrikes against dozens of Islamic State targets in Syria on Friday in retaliation for an attack on U.S. personnel, U.S. officials said on Friday.

title: Russian Strike Kills 7 In Ukraine's Coastal Odesa Region
content: A Russian ballistic missile strike killed seven and wounded 15 in Ukraine's Black Sea Odesa region, a local governor said Friday, adding that the attack targeted port infrastructure.

title: Trump Refuses To Rule Out War With Venezuela
content: President Donald Trump left the possibility of war with Venezuela on the table in an interview published Friday, after escalating the US pressure campaign on Caracas with an oil blockade.

title: Erika Kirk, Widow Of Right-Wing Activist, Endorses JD Vance For US President
content: The widow of murdered right-wing activist Charlie Kirk has endorsed JD Vance for president in 2028, firing an early starting gun on the White House race, and offering the backing of the influential youth organization founded by her husband.

title: Putin Warns Of 'Severe' Consequences If Frozen Russian Assets Used For Ukraine
content: Putin warned Friday that "severe consequences" would have followed for the EU if it had approved using frozen Russian assets to finance Ukraine -- after the bloc failed to approve the plan.

title: Indian Armed Forces Are NDTV Indian Of The Year 2025
content: Following a phenomenal display of valour, coordination and pinpoint precision during Operation Sindoor, the Indian Armed Forces have been named NDTV's Indian Of The Year for 2025.

title: Trump Was Right To Sue BBC Over Edited Clips Of His Speech: Putin
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin told his annual end-of-year press conference on Friday that US President Donald Trump was right to sue the BBC over edited clips of his speech.

title: Probe Agency Challenges Order On Chargesheet Against Sonia, Rahul Gandhi
content: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Friday approached the Delhi High Court challenging a trial court's order refusing to take cognisance of its charge sheet against Congress leaders Sonia Gandhi, Rahul Gandhi and others in the National Herald case.

title: Famine Over In Gaza But Food Situation Remains Critical: UN
content: A famine declared in Gaza in August is now over thanks to improved access for humanitarian aid, the United Nations said on Friday, but warned the food situation in the Palestinian territory remained dire.

title: 'It's A Circus': Sarcastic Messages Appear On Big Screen As Putin Speaks
content: Sarcastic messages briefly flashed up on a big screen in the hall where Russian President Vladimir Putin was holding his annual press conference and "direct line" phone-in on Friday.

title: Highlights: Indian Armed Forces Are NDTV’s Indian Of The Year 2025
content: NDTV celebrated outstanding Indians across 14 diverse categories spanning business leadership, innovation, philanthropy, governance, sports, entertainment, culture, and science.

title: Bangladesh Protests Highlights: Border Guard Bangladesh Deployed Across Dhaka Amid Unrest
content: Bangladesh Violence Highlights: Bangladesh has been rocked by violent protests since late Thursday after the death of student leader Sharif Osman Hadi, with concerns of further unrest ahead of national elections in the country.

title: Passenger Says Pilot Thrashed Him, Left Him Bloodied. Airline Responds
content: A SpiceJet passenger alleged he was assaulted by an Air India Express pilot when he objected to the pilot cutting the boarding queue.

title: Watch: Russian Journalist Proposes To Girlfriend During Putin's Live Presser
content: An unexpected romantic moment unfolded during Russian President Vladimir Putin's lengthy annual press conference when a young journalist turned the global broadcast into a marriage proposal before going on to question the president.

title: Behind Bangladesh Leader's Rise: Anti-India Stance And Extremists' Support
content: Sharif Osman Hadi, the radical student leader and aspiring lawmaker whose killing has triggered a fresh wave of violence in Dhaka, had had a meteoric rise in Bangladesh after the ouster of former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina last year.

title: Over 1,000 Patients Died Awaiting Evacuation From Gaza Since July 2024: WHO
content: More than 1,000 patients have died while waiting for urgent medical evacuation from war-ravaged Gaza in the last year and a half, the World Health Organization said Friday.
